about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.text: Pedestrians using guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn off your engine until the person crosses the street.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait until the person crosses the street.

comment.text: Wait until the person crosses the street.

acceptedAnswer.text: Wait until the person crosses the street.

comment.text: Wait until the person crosses the street.

hasPart.name: At an uncontrolled intersection where you cannot see cross traffic until you are just about to enter the intersection, the speed limit is:

about.name: At an uncontrolled intersection where you cannot see cross traffic until you are just about to enter the intersection, the speed limit is:

hasPart.assesses: At an uncontrolled intersection where you cannot see cross traffic until you are just about to enter the intersection, the speed limit is: | At an uncontrolled intersection where you cannot see cross traffic until you are just about to enter the intersection, the speed limit is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: The speed limit for a blind intersection is 15 mph. An intersection is considered “blind” if there are no stop signs on any corner and you cannot see for 100 feet in either direction during the last 100 feet before crossing.

comment.text: 15 mph.
25 mph.
20 mph.
15 mph.

answerExplanation.text: The speed limit for a blind intersection is 15 mph. An intersection is considered “blind” if there are no stop signs on any corner and you cannot see for 100 feet in either direction during the last 100 feet before crossing.

hasPart.name: You should turn on your headlights:

about.name: You should turn on your headlights:

hasPart.assesses: You should turn on your headlights: | You should turn on your headlights: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Headlights must be used one half hour after sunset until one half hour before sunrise, when windshield wipers are being used due to rain or snow, and in any other situation when visibility is less than 1,000 feet. They should be used when a car is being driven on a small country or mountain road, even in sunny weather.

comment.text: One half hour after sunset.

suggestedAnswer.text: When stopped at a railroad crossing.

comment.text: When stopped at a railroad crossing.
When parked at a school.
One half hour after sunset.

answerExplanation.text: Headlights must be used one half hour after sunset until one half hour before sunrise, when windshield wipers are being used due to rain or snow, and in any other situation when visibility is less than 1,000 feet. They should be used when a car is being driven on a small country or mountain road, even in sunny weather.

comment.text: You should turn on your headlights: | Headlights must be used one half hour after sunset until one half hour before sunrise, when windshield wipers are being used due to rain or snow, and in any other situation when visibility is less than 1,000 feet. They should be used when a car is being driven on a small country or mountain road, even in sunny weather.

hasPart.name: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first?

about.name: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first?

hasPart.assesses: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first? | A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If a vehicle merges in front of you too closely, take your foot off of the accelerator. This will create space between you and the vehicle ahead without requiring you to slam on your brakes or swerve into another lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Honk and step on the brake firmly.

comment.text: Honk and step on the brake firmly.

suggestedAnswer.text: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

comment.text: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

suggestedAnswer.text: Swerve into the lane next to you.

comment.text: Swerve into the lane next to you.

acceptedAnswer.text: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

comment.text: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

answerExplanation.text: If a vehicle merges in front of you too closely, take your foot off of the accelerator. This will create space between you and the vehicle ahead without requiring you to slam on your brakes or swerve into another lane.

comment.text: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first? | If a vehicle merges in front of you too closely, take your foot off of the accelerator. This will create space between you and the vehicle ahead without requiring you to slam on your brakes or swerve into another lane.

hasPart.name: When a pedestrian guided by a dog or carrying a white cane is crossing the street:

about.name: When a pedestrian guided by a dog or carrying a white cane is crossing the street:

hasPart.assesses: When a pedestrian guided by a dog or carrying a white cane is crossing the street: | When a pedestrian guided by a dog or carrying a white cane is crossing the street: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must always yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian who is using a guide dog or carrying a white cane.

suggestedAnswer.text: You must always yield the right-of-way.

comment.text: You must always yield the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: You must tell them where to cross the street.

comment.text: You must tell them where to cross the street.

suggestedAnswer.text: You only have to yield the right-of-way if you are at a corner.

comment.text: You only have to yield the right-of-way if you are at a corner.

acceptedAnswer.text: You must always yield the right-of-way.

comment.text: You must always yield the right-of-way.

answerExplanation.text: Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must always yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian who is using a guide dog or carrying a white cane.

comment.text: When a pedestrian guided by a dog or carrying a white cane is crossing the street: | Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must always yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian who is using a guide dog or carrying a white cane.

hasPart.name: For which of the following traffic lights must you always stop your vehicle?

about.name: For which of the following traffic lights must you always stop your vehicle?

hasPart.assesses: For which of the following traffic lights must you always stop your vehicle? | For which of the following traffic lights must you always stop your vehicle? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must stop at a solid or flashing red light, or at a signal light that is blacked out (not working). A solid yellow light means that the signal is about to turn red and you must stop if you can do so safely; otherwise, proceed cautiously. A flashing yellow light means that you should proceed with caution, but you do not need to stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and blacked out traffic signals.

comment.text: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and blacked out traffic signals.

suggestedAnswer.text: Solid red lights, red arrows, and flashing yellow lights.

comment.text: Solid red lights, red arrows, and flashing yellow lights.

suggestedAnswer.text: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and yellow lights.

comment.text: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and yellow lights.

acceptedAnswer.text: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and blacked out traffic signals.

comment.text: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and blacked out traffic signals.

answerExplanation.text: You must stop at a solid or flashing red light, or at a signal light that is blacked out (not working). A solid yellow light means that the signal is about to turn red and you must stop if you can do so safely; otherwise, proceed cautiously. A flashing yellow light means that you should proceed with caution, but you do not need to stop.

comment.text: For which of the following traffic lights must you always stop your vehicle? | You must stop at a solid or flashing red light, or at a signal light that is blacked out (not working). A solid yellow light means that the signal is about to turn red and you must stop if you can do so safely; otherwise, proceed cautiously. A flashing yellow light means that you should proceed with caution, but you do not need to stop.
